cards.name: Sift Through Sands
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card.
If you've cast a spell named Peer Through Depths and a spell named Reach Through Mists this turn, you may search your library for a card named The Unspeakable, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard a card.
If you played a spell named Peer Through Depths and a spell named Reach Through Mists this turn, you may search your library for a card named The Unspeakable, put it into play, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Sire of the Storm
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: This storm blows gales through the dreams of men.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may draw a card.

cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: "You hide your actions from eyes on the ground, but nothing escapes the clouds."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Draw a card, then discard a card.

Flying

cards.text:
Flying
{3}, Return three lands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "The clouds obey my whims, and you'll obey theirs."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}, Return three lands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

Flying

Flying
{3}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Target creature you control can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.text:
Flying
{3}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor: "To prevent, one must first predict."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Soratami Seer
cards.text:
Flying
{4}, Return two lands you control to their owner's hand: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor: Their mirrors show two worlds: that which is and that which should be.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{4}, Return two lands you control to their owner's hand: Discard your hand, then draw that many cards.

cards.name: Squelch
cards.text:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Oku-Doku had gone through all the motions: the same akki cursewords, the same ingredients with their horrid stink, the same rude gestures. Yet not a person died.

rulings.text: Squelch can't target a mana ability because mana abilities don't use the stack.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Student of Elements
cards.text: When Student of Elements has flying, flip it.
cards.originalText: When Student of Elements has flying, flip it.

cards.name: Tobita, Master of Winds
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.
cards.originalText: When Student of Elements has flying, flip it.

cards.name: Swirl the Mists
cards.text:
As Swirl the Mists enters the battlefield, choose a color word.
All instances of color words in the text of spells and permanents are changed to the chosen color word.

rulings.text: This effect lasts as long as Swirl the Mists is on the battlefield. It ends as soon as Swirl the Mists leaves the battlefield.
Swirl the Mists' ability also affects spells that are cast and permanents that enter the battlefield after Swirl the Mists enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
As Swirl the Mists comes into play, choose a color word.
All instances of color words on spells and permanents become the chosen color word.

cards.name: Teller of Tales
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor: Words never uttered by mortals flowed incessantly from its many mouths.

rulings.text: You choose whether or not to tap or untap the creature when the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Thoughtbind
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 4 or less.
cards.flavor:
"As the rest of the mortal world waged war, Lady Azami and her students invaded tomes of knowledge. Their search yielded spells critical in the fight."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 4 or less.

cards.name: Time Stop
cards.text: End the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to their maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

rulings.text: Exiling a spell or ability prevents that spell or ability from resolving, but it doesn't technically "counter" anything. This means that Time Stop can exile spells and abilities that "can't be countered."

Unless Time Stop is cast during the Ending phase, any "at the beginning of the end step"-triggered abilities don't get the chance to trigger on the turn Time Stop is cast. These abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step.

Ending the turn this way means the following things happen in order: 1) All spells and abilities on the stack are exiled. This includes Time Stop, though it will continue to resolve. It also includes spells and abilities that can't be countered. 2) All attacking and blocking creatures are removed from combat. 3) State-based actions are checked. No player gets priority, and no triggered abilities are put onto the stack. 4) The current phase and/or step ends. The game skips straight to the cleanup step. The cleanup step happens in its entirety.

If any triggered abilities do trigger during this process, they're put onto the stack during the cleanup step. If this happens, players will have a chance to cast spells and activate abilities, then there will be another cleanup step before the turn finally ends.

cards.originalText: End the turn. (Remove all spells and abilities on the stack from the game, including this card. The player whose turn it is discards down to his or her maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

cards.name: The Unspeakable
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever The Unspeakable deals combat damage to a player, you may return target Arcane card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: It is madness that drives men to seek forbidden knowledge, and madness has given it form.

foreignNames.name: 語られざるもの、忌話図

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
Whenever The Unspeakable deals combat damage to a player, you may return target Arcane card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return two lands you control to their owner's hand: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

rulings.text: If you copy an Arcane spell that has cards spliced onto it, you'll copy the spliced text as well as the original spell text.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Return two lands you control to their owner's hand: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Wandering Ones
cards.flavor:
"I saw them once, when I was a child. They led me to my parents' arms when I was lost. Why have they abandoned me now? Why won't they take me home again?"
—Unnamed beggar

cards.name: Ashen-Skin Zubera
cards.text: When Ashen-Skin Zubera dies, target opponent discards a card for each Zubera that died this turn.
cards.flavor: When the Honden of Night's Reach began to crumble, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to haunt mortal dreams.
cards.originalText: When Ashen-Skin Zubera is put into a graveyard from play, target opponent discards a card for each Zubera put into a graveyard from play this turn.

cards.name: Befoul
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"When the rampaging kami at Reito had crushed the opposing militia, swarms of minor kami swept over the battlefield to consume all that remained."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa

rulings.text: This is not modal. You do not have to choose the target type. The target has to either be a land or non-black creature when announced and on resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Blood Speaker
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Blood Speaker. If you do, search your library for a Demon card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Whenever a Demon enters the battlefield under your control, return Blood Speaker from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The return-to-hand triggered ability triggers while Blood Speaker is in your graveyard, no matter how it got there.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Blood Speaker. If you do, search your library for a Demon card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Whenever a Demon comes into play under your control, return Blood Speaker from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Bloodthirsty Ogre
cards.text:
{T}: Put a devotion counter on Bloodthirsty Ogre.
{T}: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of devotion counters on Bloodthirsty Ogre. Activate this ability only if you control a Demon.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Put a devotion counter on Bloodthirsty Ogre.
{T}: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of devotion counters on Bloodthirsty Ogre. Play this ability only if you control a Demon.

cards.name: Cranial Extraction
cards.text: Choose a nonland card name. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.originalText: Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with that name and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, Cruel Deceiver gains "Whenever Cruel Deceiver deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature" until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

{1}: Look at the top card of your library.

cards.name: Deathcurse Ogre

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Hideous Laughter
cards.text:
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{B}{B} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{B}{B} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Night of Souls' Betrayal
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"How can we wage war against ourselves? What happens when the kami of our very souls rise against us? I answer simply: We cannot. We die. There can be no victory in this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda

rulings.text: If a second Night of Souls' Betrayal comes under your control, you'll put one into its owner's graveyard due to the "legend rule" at the same time that any creatures getting -2/-2 are put into their owner's graveyard for having 0 or less toughness.

cards.originalText:
Sacrifice Scuttling Death: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Soulshift 4 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Seizan, Perverter of Truth
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 2 life and draws two cards.
cards.flavor:
"If you would taste the wisdom of the oni, be prepared to salt it with your blood."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

foreignNames.name: 真実を捻じ曲げるもの、逝斬

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 2 life and draws two cards.

cards.name: Soulless Revival
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{B} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{B} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Struggle for Sanity
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. That player exiles a card from it, then you exile a card from it. Repeat this process until all cards in that hand have been exiled. That player returns the cards they exiled this way to their hand and puts the rest into their graveyard.
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. That player sets aside a card from it, then you set aside a card from it. Repeat this process until all cards in that hand have been set aside. That player returns the cards he or she set aside to his or her hand and puts the rest into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Swallowing Plague
cards.text: Swallowing Plague deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life.
cards.flavor:
"We are recalling all forces from the Takenuma Swamp. We lose men daily to kami attacks, and it seems our defeats only encourage them further."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda
cards.originalText: Swallowing Plague deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life.

cards.name: Thief of Hope
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Soulshift 2 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Soulshift 2 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Villainous Ogre
cards.text:
Villainous Ogre can't block.
As long as you control a Demon, Villainous Ogre has "{B}: Regenerate Villainous Ogre."
cards.flavor:
"The war saw the ogres emerge from their caves, reeking of blood, with the power of oni in their veins."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText:
Villainous Ogre can't block.
As long as you control a Demon, Villainous Ogre has "{B}: Regenerate Villainous Ogre."

cards.name: Waking Nightmare
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Once each year, the oni and other evil spirits paraded through villages to disturb mortals' sleep. During the war, this parade became a nightly event."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Wicked Akuba
cards.text: {B}: Target player dealt damage by Wicked Akuba this turn loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: The sound of children weeping is a song that fills its heart with joy.
cards.originalText: {B}: Target player dealt damage by Wicked Akuba this turn loses 1 life.

cards.name: Akki Avalanchers
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: Akki Avalanchers gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Among Godo's hordes, "beware of falling rocks" came to mean "akki live nearby."

rulings.text: The "activate this ability only once each turn" restriction applies even if the creature changes controllers.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Akki Avalanchers gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Akki Coalflinger
cards.text:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: No matter where you find them, goblins love rocks.
cards.originalText:
First strike
{R}, {T}: Attacking creatures gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Akki Lavarunner
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Akki Lavarunner deals damage to an opponent, flip it.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever Akki Lavarunner deals damage to an opponent, flip it.

cards.name: Tok-Tok, Volcano Born
cards.text:
Protection from red
If a red source would deal damage to a player, it deals that much damage plus 1 to that player instead.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever Akki Lavarunner deals damage to an opponent, flip it.

cards.name: Akki Rockspeaker
cards.text: When Akki Rockspeaker enters the battlefield, add {R}.
cards.flavor: The lava-proof shells of akki evolved over centuries, as akki pranks almost always got seriously out of hand.

rulings.text: You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

cards.originalText: When Akki Rockspeaker comes into play, add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Akki Underminer
cards.text: Whenever Akki Underminer deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Deep inside the Sokenzan Mountains, a band of akki discovered a cache of ancient items of power. Their ensuing spree of destruction became known as 'The Three Days of Fun.'"
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText: Whenever Akki Underminer deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a permanent.

cards.name: Battle-Mad Ronin
cards.text:
Bushido 2 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
Battle-Mad Ronin attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: "I fought fiercely, bravely, and without mercy. Had I not struck down my captain in the heat of battle, I might have become a hero instead of an outcast."
cards.originalText:
Bushido 2 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)
Battle-Mad Ronin attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Ben-Ben, Akki Hermit
cards.text: {T}: Ben-Ben, Akki Hermit deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of untapped Mountains you control.
cards.flavor: Some akki thought of Ben-Ben as a kami of trickery in disguise. They hunted for him in the maze of warrens, often falling prey to his traps.
cards.originalText: {T}: Ben-Ben, Akki Hermit deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of untapped Mountains you control.

cards.name: Blind with Anger
cards.text: Untap target nonlegendary creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I can post only the most honorable and strong-willed samurai to defend your stronghold. I have seen what can happen to lesser men."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda
cards.originalText: Untap target nonlegendary creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Blood Rites
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Blood Rites deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"The threat of the kami was made worse by the blood rituals of the ogres, who freed terrifying oni to wander Kamigawa unhindered."
—Observations of the Kami War
cards.originalText: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Blood Rites deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Brothers Yamazaki
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If there are exactly two permanents named Brothers Yamazaki on the battlefield, the "legend rule" doesn't apply to them.
Each other creature named Brothers Yamazaki gets +2/+2 and has haste.

rulings.text: The two Brothers could be controlled by different players.
There are two versions of this card, each with different art. The cards are numbered 160a/306 and 160b/306. The art has no effect on game play.

If a third Brothers Yamazaki enters the battlefield, the legend rule will apply. If one player controls more than one Brothers Yamazaki at that time, that player will have choose one and put the rest into their graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If there are exactly two permanents named Brothers Yamazaki in play, the "legend rule" doesn't apply to them.
Each other creature named Brothers Yamazaki gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.name: Brothers Yamazaki
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If there are exactly two permanents named Brothers Yamazaki on the battlefield, the "legend rule" doesn't apply to them.
Each other creature named Brothers Yamazaki gets +2/+2 and has haste.

rulings.text: The two Brothers could be controlled by different players.
There are two versions of this card, each with different art. The cards are numbered 160a/306 and 160b/306. The art has no effect on game play.

If a third Brothers Yamazaki enters the battlefield, the legend rule will apply. If one player controls more than one Brothers Yamazaki at that time, that player will have choose one and put the rest into their graveyard.

Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
If there are exactly two permanents named Brothers Yamazaki in play, the "legend rule" doesn't apply to them.
Each other creature named Brothers Yamazaki gets +2/+2 and has haste.

cards.name: Brutal Deceiver
cards.text:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, Brutal Deceiver gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land, Brutal Deceiver gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Crushing Pain
cards.text: Crushing Pain deals 6 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
cards.flavor: It is said that the mere touch of a kami is like embracing the sun itself.
cards.originalText: Crushing Pain deals 6 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Desperate Ritual
cards.text:
Add {R}{R}{R}.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.
Desperate Ritual isn't a mana ability. When cast, it (or the spell it's spliced onto) goes on the stack like any spell and can be responded to.

cards.originalText:
Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Devouring Rage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. For each Spirit sacrificed this way, that creature gets an additional +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Devouring Rage, you may sacrifice any number of Spirits.
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. For each Spirit sacrificed this way, that creature gets an additional +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Earthshaker
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Earthshaker deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: It scaled the Sokenzan Mountains in search of Kumano's secret. The mountain shook for two days, and the kami never returned.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Earthshaker deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Ember-Fist Zubera
cards.text: When Ember-Fist Zubera dies, it deals damage to any target equal to the number of Zubera that died this turn.
cards.flavor: When the Honden of Infinite Rage shattered, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to sow mortal destruction.
cards.originalText: When Ember-Fist Zubera is put into a graveyard from play, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Zubera put into all graveyards from play this turn.

cards.name: Frostwielder
cards.text:
If a creature dealt damage by Frostwielder this turn would die, exile it instead.
{T}: Frostwielder deals 1 damage to any target.

rulings.text: Frostwielder must be on the battlefield when the creature would be put into a graveyard in order to exile it.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Frostwielder deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
If a creature dealt damage by Frostwielder this turn would be put into a graveyard, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Glacial Ray
cards.text:
Glacial Ray deals 2 damage to any target.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Glacial Ray deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Godo, Bandit Warlord
cards.text:
When Godo, Bandit Warlord enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Equipment card and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.
Whenever Godo attacks for the first time each turn, untap it and all Samurai you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

rulings.text: Unlike other effects that grant additional combat phases, you don't get an additional main phase with Godo, Bandit Warlord. The additional combat phase happens immediately after the first combat phase.

foreignNames.name: Godo, señor de la guerra de los bandidos

cards.originalText:
When Godo, Bandit Warlord comes into play, you may search your library for an Equipment card and put it into play. If you do, shuffle your library.
Whenever Godo attacks for the first time each turn, untap it and all Samurai you control. After this phase, you get an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Hanabi Blast
cards.text: Hanabi Blast deals 2 damage to any target. Return Hanabi Blast to its owner's hand, then discard a card at random.
cards.flavor: The most powerful of akki fire spells were developed at the cost of blood, toil, tears, sweat, and usually a nose or two.

rulings.text: If another player casts a Hanabi Blast that you own, it returns to your hand, and then that player discards a card at random.

cards.originalText: Hanabi Blast deals 2 damage to target creature or player. Return Hanabi Blast to its owner's hand, then discard a card at random.

cards.name: Hearth Kami
cards.text: {X}, Sacrifice Hearth Kami: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor:
"Every treachery, great or small, begets a spirit that rages at the injustice. Given the opportunity, each will return that treachery to its owner tenfold."
—Sensei Hisoka
cards.originalText: {X}, Sacrifice Hearth Kami: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X.

cards.name: Honden of Infinite Rage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to any target equal to the number of Shrines you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Shrines you control.

cards.name: Initiate of Blood
cards.text: {T}: Initiate of Blood deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn. When that creature dies this turn, flip Initiate of Blood.
cards.originalText: {T}: Initiate of Blood deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn. When that creature is put into a graveyard this turn, flip Initiate of Blood.

cards.name: Goka the Unjust
cards.text: {T}: Goka the Unjust deals 4 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Initiate of Blood deals 1 damage to target creature that was dealt damage this turn. When that creature is put into a graveyard this turn, flip Initiate of Blood.

cards.name: Kami of Fire's Roar
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"I can hear the shamans chanting in the hills. They say their magic will protect us from the kami, that our gold has bought our safety. But no one sleeps soundly tonight."
—Scroll fragment from the ruins of Reito
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker
cards.text:
Haste
{T}: Create a token that's a copy of target nonlegendary creature you control, except it has haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: The token copies exactly what was printed on the creature and nothing else (unless that creature was copying something else or was a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature was tapped or untapped, whether it had any counters on it or Auras and/or Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that changed its power, toughness, types, color, and so on.
If the copied creature had {X} in its mana cost, X is 0.
If the copied creature was copying something else, the tokens enter the battlefield as whatever that creature was copying.
If the copied creature is a token, the tokens created by Kiki-Jiki's ability copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when the tokens enter the battlefield. Any "As [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[This creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the copied creature will also work.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{T}: Put a creature token into play that's a copy of target nonlegendary creature you control. That creature token has haste. Sacrifice it at end of turn.

cards.name: Kumano, Master Yamabushi
cards.text:
{1}{R}: Kumano, Master Yamabushi deals 1 damage to any target.
If a creature dealt damage by Kumano this turn would die, exile it instead.

rulings.text: Kumano, Master Yamabushi must be on the battlefield when the creature would be put into a graveyard in order to exile it.
If a creature dealt damage by Kumano this turn would be put into a graveyard, exile it, even if it's going to the graveyard at the same time as Kumano.

cards.originalText:
{1}{R}: Kumano, Master Yamabushi deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
If a creature dealt damage by Kumano this turn would be put into a graveyard, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Kumano's Pupils
cards.text: If a creature dealt damage by Kumano's Pupils this turn would die, exile it instead.
cards.flavor:
"Long before he reluctantly joined the war, stories spread of Kumano's followers winning victories against the kami."
—Observations of the Kami War

rulings.text: If a creature dealt damage by Kumano's Pupils this turn would be put into a graveyard, exile it instead, even if it's going to the graveyard at the same time as Kumano's Pupils.
Kumano's Pupils must be on the battlefield when the creature would be put into a graveyard in order to exile it.

cards.originalText: If a creature dealt damage by Kumano's Pupils this turn would be put into a graveyard, remove it from the game instead.
